docs.snippet: Yasiel Puig had three hits to back a scoreless outing by Hyun-Jin Ryu in Sydney as the Dodgers won both games of the season-opening series....
docs.lead_paragraph: Yasiel Puig had three hits to back a scoreless outing by Hyun-Jin Ryu in Sydney as the Dodgers won both games of the season-opening series.

headline.main: Dodgers Beat Diamondbacks, 7-5, for Down-Under Sweep

docs.snippet: Base hits before the season opens are appreciated, but more important to experienced batters like Derek Jeter is progress in their approach and form at the plate....
docs.lead_paragraph: Base hits before the season opens are appreciated, but more important to experienced batters like Derek Jeter is progress in their approach and form at the plate.
docs.abstract: Spring training has nothing to do with the regular season for veteran hitters like New York Yankees' Derek Jeter; he and other experienced batters appreciate any base hits they make, but mainly want to progress in their approach and form at the plate.

headline.main: Jeter’s Meager Average in Spring Training Does Not Worry Him or Girardi
headline.print_headline: Jeter’s Meager Average in Spring Training Does Not Worry Him or Girardi

docs.snippet: A group led by the former Expos outfielder Warren Cromartie has envisioned bringing a major league team back to Montreal after it has gone a decade without one....
docs.lead_paragraph: A group led by the former Expos outfielder Warren Cromartie has envisioned bringing a major league team back to Montreal after it has gone a decade without one.
docs.abstract: Major League Baseball will return to Montreal for first time since 2004, final year Montreal Expos played there before becoming Washington Nationals, as New York Mets and Toronto Blue Jays play exhibition game; despite ragged past, group led by former Expos outfielder Warren Cromartie hopes to draw a team back to Montreal.

headline.seo: Montreal Hopes Mets-Blue Jays Exhibition Is Just the Beginning
headline.main: City That Squandered Baseball Relishes Brief Return
headline.print_headline: City That Squandered Baseball Relishes Brief Return

docs.snippet: With two black eyes, pitcher Aroldis Chapman returned to the Cincinnati Reds’ clubhouse four days after being hit in the face by a line drive....
docs.lead_paragraph: With two black eyes, pitcher Aroldis Chapman returned to the Cincinnati Reds’ clubhouse four days after being hit in the face by a line drive.
docs.abstract: Aroldis Chapman returns to Cincinnati Reds’ clubhouse four days after being hit in the face by a line drive; had surgery to repair broken bone and is expected to be out six to eight weeks; other baseball news noted.

docs.snippet: The 2014 baseball season opened on Saturday with two games between the Dodgers and the Diamondbacks in Sydney, Australia. Apps, including Major League Baseball’s At Bat, offer news, scorecards and results....
docs.lead_paragraph: The 2014 baseball season opened on Saturday with two games between the Dodgers and the Diamondbacks in Sydney, Australia. Apps, including Major League Baseball’s At Bat, offer news, scorecards and results.

docs.snippet: Former managers Ozzie Guillen and Eric Wedge are in the ESPN lineup this season for "Baseball Tonight."...

docs.snippet: There can be little doubt Major League Baseball (MLB) hit a home run with its first visit to Australia in a century after nearly 80,000 fans swarmed to the Sydney Cricket Ground over the weekend to get a taste of America's pastime....
docs.lead_paragraph: There can be little doubt Major League Baseball (MLB) hit a home run with its first visit to Australia in a century after nearly 80,000 fans swarmed to the Sydney Cricket Ground over the weekend to get a taste of America's pastime.

headline.main: Major Leagues a Big Hit Down Under but Legacy Uncertain
headline.print_headline: Major Leagues a Big Hit Down Under but Legacy Uncertain
